sph_interpretive_translation: Therein, food and drink shall be safeguarded by those who are time-knowers, self-established, irreproachable attendants, thoroughly examined, and purified through mantras that remove toxicity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in those whose consciousness is aligned with temporal and spiritual knowledge.
Causation is maintained through purity-preserving actions and purified instruments.
Capacity-based responsibility requires the custodian to embody integrity and discernment.
Restoration logic demands prevention of impurity at source rather than correction post-fall.
Consciousness alignment ensures that service is rendered without contamination or deviation.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a sustainer of offerings IS NOT verified for irreproachability THEN access to sacred provisioning MUST BE DENIED.
IF provisioning materials ARE NOT inspected under mantra-purification protocols THEN they SHALL NOT enter consecrated domains.
IF an attendant's capacity for self-governance IS COMPROMISED THEN their role in sustenance management SHALL BE REVOKED.
IF temporal awareness IS ABSENT in custodians THEN provisioning duties SHALL BE ASSIGNED to time-knowers only.
IF purity verification IS NEGLECTED THEN automatic disqualification of provisioning eligibility SHALL OCCUR.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes the threshold of fitness for individuals managing communal or sacred resources. Responsibility is tied not to position but to verifiable states of consciousness and conduct. The court must assess whether custodians have undergone rigorous scrutiny and purification before assigning roles involving societal nourishment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa here lies in observable proof of sustained purity and temporal wisdom. Anupūrvaśaḥ reflects the sequential necessity: first purification, then eligibility; first self-mastery, then service. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of proximity to sacred sustenance. There is no punitive element—removal from duty is a natural consequence of unfitness, not retribution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Reverification process through mantra-assisted assessment of intent and action.
Reintegration protocol via supervised apprenticeship under time-knowers.
Completion mechanism ensuring all prior provisioning errors are traced and corrected.
Capacity restoration through disciplined retreat and purification practices.
Integrity reintegration upon successful demonstration of irreversible alignment.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through conscious custodianship. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the ultimate adjudicator.
